body_content.explanation: (of a team, band, or other group of people) to join together again as a group; to join people together again as a group:
examples: In May 2006, Take That announced they were re-forming after ten years.
The Social Democratic Party had been re-formed in October 1989.
The reformed band's new album comes out on Tuesday.

body_content.explanation: to begin to exist again, or to make something begin to exist again:
examples: The remnants of the storm re-formed over Minnesota.
He jetted into Manchester to re-form his partnership with City boss Joe Royle - who was his boss at Everton.
